website_summaries.verdict: An expensive option but one of the most highly reviewed systems. Over 100 levels of of stimulation.
pros: Suitable for any dog over 5 pounds
1/2 mile range and nighttime visibility for training at any time
Easy to add second dog to the system
cons: Might be too much for amateur trainers

customer_reviews.title: Died After 7 Months...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in May 2017. It is now January of 2018 and it no longer works. Highly disappointed! Bought a $200 collar precisely so I wouldn't run into problems like this.
customer_reviews.author: sydfran

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in early February and now it has stopped working completely. Like others have said it needs to be charged constantly. Lucky to get a single day out of it before it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: dad2ccc

customer_reviews.title: I had one for years, now they don't even last a month.
customer_reviews.text: The E-Collars, with proper use, are wonderful training tools. Unfortunately, the charger doesn't work and I'm 2 days passed the 30 days in order to return it (I was out of town and didn't discover it until recently). Bummed, but hopeful that it'll be fixed. So I did get a return for the charger, which was great. But now (31 days in), the receiver won't charge. What is going on here? I had my last one for years, but now they don't last more than a month. I off-leash hike a lot, and love that this product has a light, but I'm starting to think I may have to find another brand. Bummed again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Started out ok but now the batter does before the end of the day. Constantly needs to Be charged. There’s something wrong with the one I received. It used to Go days without a charge now it can barely make a few hours. So disappointed for the price we paid and now the return window is closed.
customer_reviews.author: gina marie

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a year....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this collar in May 2018. It is now February 2019 and one stimulation button has completely lost all function and the other stimulation functions don't work half of the time. Unsure if it is the remote or the collar that stopped working, but either way I am not very impressed with the longevity of this collar as I purchased the item for $180 so that I would not have issues like this.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what to do!!!! We bought a collar. After a few weeks the shock feature became intermittent. Sometimes it worked and sometimes it didn’t. It wasn’t as sensitive. My dog felt the shock on a 3. When it wasn’t working, it would take a 16 for him to feel it. I tested it myself too! Then while he was wearing it it would randomly start working again, and when it was completely working, a 16 was WAY too much for him! Just got a replacement collar. Same issue after 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Receiver stopped working after less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a while, unfortunately after less than a year the receiver (the part on the collar) stopped turning on when you touch the remote to it. It will still light up green when plugged in to charge, but does not come on at all. I essentially spent close to three hundred for a training collar I got less than a year’s use out of.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Over the course of the past two months, this product has broken down in different ways. First one would not adjust the shock level and the second one has not been able to stay on for longer than three minutes (most likely a battery issue). I am not sure how to even get support for this product for warranty purposes.
customer_reviews.author: nikster0029

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to figure out!
customer_reviews.text: I am not dumb, I hold two degrees, one being a masters degree but could not figure this out. Way too complicated, never got to even get past the directions. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, unsafe
customer_reviews.text: The battery life of this product is atrocious. It also frequently unpairs with the remote, rendering it utterly useless. Going back immediately, this was not a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Megan L.

customer_reviews.title: Far too complicated for typical use
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously complicated to use. Maybe it works well for highly trained working dogs, I don’t know. But don’t bother if it’s for a typical family dog.
customer_reviews.author: I.D.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work in saltwater!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I live down in the Florida Keys and take my dogs to the beach every other day. I wanted to be able to control them when they run off. This product works great when they are dry. It works great in freshwater. It does not work in saltwater. I tested it on myself, turned it up to 88. out of water I can feel it at 10. The more salt in the water the less you can feel it. Called the manufacturer directly, and they are denying this fact. I have even sent them a video showing it. So if you live near saltwater, this is not the collar for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B.

customer_reviews.title: This product work extremely well at first. On a ...
customer_reviews.text: This product work extremely well at first. On a relatively low setting, my high-energy 10 month old puppy responded to prompts to "place" and "come." We accomplished more in two days than we had with 16 weeks of dog training classes. Unfortunately, within one month, the device malfunctioned. It would not hold a charge and become completely ineffective. I am grateful to Amazon. I called and they offered to replace the device free of charge. Hopefully the new one will not have the same defect as the original. If the device functioned properly, I would have given a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Expensive for a Product That Does Not Work for 2 Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs and needed a transmitter which could manage two different dogs and stim levels. This transmitter might as well be for one dog...The transmitter can only manage one stimulation level so when you turn it up for one dog, it turns it up for the other. The stimulation lock function does not mitigate this problem because then the the transmitter doesn't function as needed for the needs of two dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E. White

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously complicated....
customer_reviews.text: Three stars for the potential I am not sure I'll unlock. This just arrived and what I thought would be a quick product tour via the manual turned into an onslaught of modes and buttonology: boost, momentary, continuous, combination, tone, tapping, "Tone followed by continuing" (I'm not kidding), stimulation (2 kinds...) and which apparently locks (what, why!?!), all to figure out before being able to simply use the normal functions. ***All I wanted were sound, vibration, and shock, available at varying levels, with reliable performance.*** I would have been happy to pay for a quality product especially one of this nature, but I think I may have paid for over-engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: What a lot of people want to know
customer_reviews.text: Is the stimulation this collar gives different from the less expensive ecollars? Yes. Just received, and will review more later, but the first thing I did when I received this was to test the intensity of the stimulation vs a cheaper collar I had previously purchased. It is much more subtle, and the collar is much more responsive than the cheaper collar that I purchased prior to this. Will add to this review later, but this is the question I was most concerned with when purchasing. I was prepared to return it immediately if there was no difference. I am keeping it. Faster response to the btton push, and way more subtle at the low level stimulation.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan P. Waller

customer_reviews.title: NOT For Small Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Might be an okay training collar but it is definitely NOT for small dogs! It says it is designed for dogs 5lbs and up...my dog is 6lbs. The box on the collar is huge and when I put it on my dog, he choked unless he was on his back. Terrible design for small dogs...might work okay for larger dogs but even then it is extremely overpriced for what you get. I didn't keep it long enough to review the batteries. I have a system I bought for our labs at Cabella's that is much easier to use and works wonderful for $30 more than this system. I would spend the extra $30 every time.
customer_reviews.author: Buys A-LOT

customer_reviews.title: Quality product that can be a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I was scared to death about using an e-collars because I have worked with dogs that had been abused and damaged by then. Then I met Ziggy . Sweet & smart poodle/ spaniel cross that refused to respond to the come command , no matter how much I used positive methods . First I used it on myself and then Ziggy learned the lowest level (8) that got his attention. Once Ziggy got it , he became a joy to be around . The Educator is a quality product that when used correctly , really works !
customer_reviews.author: curtis templeton

customer_reviews.title: I really really did not want to get this. ...
customer_reviews.text: I really really did not want to get this. But having a husky who head that is hard has a rock made wonders. For months was trying to use positive training for my dog so she wouldn’t try bitting and barking during our walk. It wasn’t going anywhere. Just in two day she learned and now she listen in sitting while stranger pass by. I only use the shock feature when she was trying to bit, attack, bark during our walks. I would give her a warning with the vibrate to get her attention towards me. She learned fast and now I don’t use it on our walks. Please understand how to use it and get help which I did.
customer_reviews.author: BN

customer_reviews.title: works very well on my German Shepherd
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I had one of these from a prior trainer. I somehow ,ost it and ordered a replacement and, guess what it arrived in 2 days and I found the old one 2 days later! In amy event, used properly it had an amazing effect in getting my dogs attention. Once that was done the rest was easy Please rread carefully or watch the training video It will help you get the most out of this evoke. It does not take any pain at all. just condition with the vibration, and miracles do happen
customer_reviews.author: D., G. Menchetti

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Watch Videos Online On How to Properly Use E-Collars
customer_reviews.text: This changed our lives. Our dog who is a boxer pitiful mix was very hyper and just all over the place. Our neighbors all have tamed, well behaved dogs who walk around their yards without a leash. Before this e-collar we couldn't even open the door without our dog running out. My husband spent hours watching videos on how to properly use the e-collar (highly recommended). The importance is consistency and establishing commands. Less than a week after training our dog, he is just like our neighbors dogs and can roam the yard freely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line E-Collar for Two
customer_reviews.text: My mini educator gives me the freedom to take my pups to restaurants and on walks without fear of dog reactivity. It's just a tool not magic so make sure you use a trainer and understand how to teach the dog the language of the ecollar (Sean O'Shea at The Good Dog or Blake Rodriguez of Dream Come True K9). But I LOVE it. And I love the tail wagging waddle I get when the pups see me take it out of the drawer, such happy pups.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: quality made but not quality
customer_reviews.text: Very paradoxical - great quality but it didn't last. I have used it regularly for months but key issues with shock feature. Batteries suck. The light on the collar is the best part - works fine every time and is so great at night. The tone process works great too but no points awarded for this simple option. I don't use the vibration. The shock options is the largest disappointment as this degraded over time to no shock - not sure why and tech support unaware. replaced tips and it works better but degrades again. Weird -making this a very expensive tone collar and light with short power cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Faber

customer_reviews.title: I have control now
customer_reviews.text: I have had 5 german shepherds, however my 6th is hardheaded and stubborn. I could never let him off leash however, after following Larry Khrons book and videos, trying it out on me first then teaching my wild one, he can now be off leash. I get such joy from seeing him running around sniffing everything so happy. Never would have happened without the e-collar. It took me a long time to get over my aversion to using this tool however I will use it as long as necessary now! I had to get the long haired dog tips from e-collar.com however it is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: I WANT TO LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This has changed my life with my dog. I could take him to the park, walk him off leash, address his aggressive behavior, but all of a sudden the collar won't hold a charge. This is not even a year old and I payed $180 for a top brand shock collar. I followed the directions and never left it charging for over 2 hours and I turned it off when I wasn't using it. I am disappointed because I have no way to get ahold of the seller either. I don't know what to do about this- I need to replace it but I am nervous its not as high quality of a product it says.
customer_reviews.author: Brax Halford

customer_reviews.title: One of the best quality products i've bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I've bought tons of cheap knock off ecollars made in China and after using this now for over a year and taking my dog to the beach daily it blows my mind how much better the quality is. It's military grade made in USA stuff that you can rely on. It makes me genuinely happy using this collar being able to rely on it knowing it won't let me down. Really wish they'd bring USA manufacturing back so people would have more great products like this and stop using cheap junk.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: It's not like the old brutal shock collars
customer_reviews.text: The only E-Collar to get. Highly adjustable. very well made. All the top trainers that I know only use this collar. It's not like the old brutal shock collars. It's like the TENs units used on people by therapists. I always test these things on myself before putting it on my dogs. I actually strapped it around my neck to test the levels. May sound crazy. But I love my pets.
customer_reviews.author: Dean puckett

customer_reviews.title: The best tool for humane training is an e-collar. Save time and stress on your dog. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: The best training tool you can use. Buy it. If you're unsure about the whole "shocking" thing: 1st. You use it only to reinforce a known command. Not to punish. 2nd. You use the lowest setting the dog can detect. (most dogs work on a less than 20 level. I can't even feel anything less than 10.) It most certainly isn't painful. Surprising or annoying would be a better word. 3rd. It's far more humane and less violent than a leash neck jerk! I'd even argue that it's better and nicer than yelling "no, bad dog". Use this tool correctly and you have the best and most direct method of getting your dog to watch and listen to you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Collar for large hard to manage dogs
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the best training collar I have found. A ton of settings (good idea to read the book and to keep it around). This if for big dogs and big dogs that need this type of "buzz". This might be a little over board if you are working with or training a typical large dog. This should be used for special training needs (reactive/aggressive/recall issues). I recommend reading book carefully and even watching training videos on Youtube. There are many settings for a reason. Settings will vary over the same training session and within different environments. This is a great tool, but please make sure you do it safely.
customer_reviews.author: Sled Better

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a nonprofessional.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for dog training. I have had this for one week and have had a noticeable difference in my puppy. She’s a family dog and hyper especially when company comes over. Last night, the hyper period only lasted 2 minutes. I could turn it up but I just want her attention so she will listen with no pain or discomfort. Hope I don’t have delusions of grandeur but my goal is a calm dog with good manors. She’s only 4 months but want bad behavior stopped now. Very happy with this e collar.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy stalcup

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on husky even with recommended adapter prong
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to be the bad news one but if you have a husky don’t bother we bought an adapter prong from the company to go along with this collar and it has no effect on our husky not happy that the retune window was 30 days we had to wait this long to get support from the company
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad electronically, but the collar material itself is completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.text: The electronic functionality is great, but the collar is awful. There should be a way to quick clip with adjustable sizing for a growing dog, using the belt buckle type they chose to use in this collar makes it nearly impossible for a person to get the collar on an active dog. It is also difficult to use with a growing dog, our only option is to cut the excess part of the collar off, but then it won’t be able to be used a year from now unless we trim it 8” to long and leave the excess dragging the ground? This is unacceptable when paying $150 for this collar system.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Turns itself off
customer_reviews.text: The vibration and shock strength of this ecollar is great, easy to adjust and very easy to use. BUT after the first few months of light to moderate use (maybe 7 days out of the month, for about 2 hours each day) the collar started turning itself off. So when I would turn it on, test it to ensure it was on, and then put it on the dog, less than 20 minutes later it wouldn’t work and I would need to turn it on again.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on the recommendation of Larry Krohn, dog trainer. (Watch his You Tube videos and you will learn the proper way to use an e collar.) Our Sheltie has a lot of fur so it is very difficult to get the collar tight enough and close enough to her skin for the "shock" to work. Luckily the "vibration" is enough to get her attention so she immediately stops her unwanted behavior. It has also greatly improved her recall. (I recommend, always testing the sensation of the collar on yourself before using it on a pet.)
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: Do not hesitate to buy. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I help train other people's dogs and am currently in the process of training a service dog. I've gone through about 3 different e-collrs including cheap ones on Amazon and a used Dogtra. All have failed. I held off on buying this because of the price but now that I have purchased this and use it every day I can tell you its so we'll worth it. The functionality of it and all the different modes is so helpful. I have the ET-300 and it's everything I'll ever need. My dog wears this all day long and I only have to charge it every three days or so.
customer_reviews.author: Cheeba

customer_reviews.title: Initially worked great but now collar won’t hold charge.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed , initially it worked great and my dog was a new dog, just by seeing the remote. However , we bought in Feb of this year and it hasn’t worked since May. It appears to charge ( the collar) and is good for less than 5 min then shuts off. It is an expensive e collar to have lost the collar portion already.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Dogs nearly died from this
customer_reviews.text: Burned two holes in each one of my teo dog's necks. The vet bill was $800. My fogs had to be sedated, wounds cleaned, and given antibiotics and steroids. The hokes were as deep as the large prongs. Infection set in and they nearly died. The collars are this lousy plastic and without spending additional money to get a "real" collar and switch it over you will have the same situation. The bungee collars are $60 each. After spending nearly $400 I wasn't ready to spend the extra $120. Instead I spent $800 at the vet snd bith dogs nearly died.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great product when used responsibly and knowledgeably.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product on a recommendation from Larry Krohn and his work with them as seen on his YouTube channel. It is very easy to work with, after reading the manual or watching Mr. Krohn's YouTube video on it. It took a minute to get it sized properly and to get the right length prongs installed (it comes with two sets - one installed, and one in a bag, in the box). After that, it was up to me to find my pup's working level and to use it properly. I would recommend this teaching aid as part of your tool box, any time!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: Wow - This has given us the freedom for our dog to walk/hike off leash. Understand that your dog needs to know the basic command first and foremost. Take the time to learn and understand how to work with your dog. My voice doesnt carry so the tone function is a big plus for me hiking.
customer_reviews.author: liza qaddourah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Dial In
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with this method of training. I have 2 young dogs that feed off one another so sometimes it's difficult to gain their attention. The e collar works a treat. I use one separately at a time for now. I may add a second collar to use for both as the controller can handle 2 collars. As both my dogs are very furry, I use the longer contact points. I recommend working with a trainer familiar with this methodology rather than going off on your own. We the owners need training or retraining from time to time also. Have a happy life with awesomely trained dogs! The e-collar is a sure fire way to get there.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice collar and best I have had like how it is like a tens unit as in Physical Therapy
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice and if used properly the dog listens well and very seldom have to use it.I like the vibrate portion of it first and I always test both sides on myself so I know what the dog is feeling. This is like and feels just like a Tens unit that they use in Physical Therapy having the option of number settings o to 100 instead of shock collar only 3 to 5 settings. This you control what number It will be on.
customer_reviews.author: D Roach

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get for two dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thinking it would be like the original just, ya know, times two. Wrongo. One dog mode is the same, two dog mode you immediately lose half the functions because they did not upgrade the remote at all. You can only have a vibrate OR stim mode active, as you’re forced to select one and then change it over and over. I will be returning and upgrading in hopes the 902 remote is any better. Their customer service said it was an improvement but still not perfect and I should probably just buy two different ecollars if I wanted all the features..defeating the purpose entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Improvements in my dogs in just two training sessions
customer_reviews.text: Within two uses my dogs have already begun to behave so much differently! This product was recommended to me from a friend to help train my dogs and it's working great so far. Make sure the collar is tight enough to make contact with their skin but not so tight that they have trouble breathing. Also, make sure to take it off when you're not home or working with your dog or when they are eating. If the collar is on the right tension they will not be able to eat while wearing this collar. Great product and so glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I really like this product.
customer_reviews.text: This has been an excellent product, I have service dog and I am disabled and have difficulty moving to and from the dog when training and working. If the collar is used properly and handled properly it is an excellent training tool. Once the dog is properly indoctrinated to the collar it is an excellent tool. I am disabled and cannot get to the dog quickly enough when training, when training a dog timing is critical. Excellent training tool when used properly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Ming

customer_reviews.title: Amazing collar, 10/10
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool to train a dog, I’ve got a GSD and he responds really well to this. It’s not a tool to hurt or cause pain. It’s a tool to save his life so he doesn’t run off or anything. I use lowest setting possible and i was trained on it professionally, which is VERY important. The range is very far and it last days on a charge. I did use the bigger prongs for him bc his coat is so thick.
customer_reviews.author: Pitty

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. Used it successfully on different dogs. While it didn't work on one, it worked on every other one I tried, and rarely ever had to even use the shock. After once, the dog never tried running out the road again. Perfect. Helps with basic commands and training and problem dogs. So happy and will use this for years to come
customer_reviews.author: Cadfang Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool when used appropriately
customer_reviews.text: Great training tool when used appropriately. Check out youtube.com solidk9training. That guy goes into great detail about using this training tool. I have 2 very headstrong catahoula dogs and they are awesome since I trained them using this product. They are under bombproof voice control for recall stay sit down place etc. Even in the woods with deer stamping and snorting at them they follow my commands off leash. Credit to this product and Jeff Gellman of solid k9 training and his free videos on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful with training
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for my lab who loves to jump and hurl himself at you. It took him a minute to adjust to what was happening but now he has adapted to when he hears the tone when doing something wrong to stop I like the the addition of a light on the collar as well, it is very bright. Has excellent battery life. You do need to make sure you have a good connection on your pet otherwise it won’t phase them
customer_reviews.author: yellowlablover

customer_reviews.title: Good e-collar, but needs different tips for long hair dogs
customer_reviews.text: I liked this e-collar, as it was a great size and strength for my German shephard, but the tips that are included are not very suitable for dogs with longer, thicker coats. I had to buy the wing tips, which worked a lot better and was more consistent. This collar helped me train my dog and she is great now! I ended up returning this collar for the mini version, as my dog didn't need as of an intense collar, and it was cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Best !
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item with trainer permission. Was able to learn and be taught how to properly use item and train dog. I tried all the "positive" training previously. This is what worked the best and completely changed my dogs behavior. 90% of the time I don't even need to use this anymore. He understands from cues and my confidence to do what I say. I got a 87lb Dane mutt finally manageable. If you plan to get more than one dog you may wanna look into purchasing the multiple dog ones instead of single. I wish I had done that since we plan to get another dog.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Still trying to find my GSD conditioning level
customer_reviews.text: Came fully charged. Did not have a testing tool for points of contact. In the booklet it says kit includes this but I have read contents on Amazon and it was not mentioned. Also other sellers do not list it either. I am not having much luck with finding my GSD conditioning level (as yet). Up to 14 and still no response. Responds to buzzer. Larry Krohn a well known trainer trains dogs at a much lower level so am wondering whether I need different points. Collar is definitely tight enough. Time will tell. Gave 5 stars due to condition of product, pricing and timely delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Gordon

customer_reviews.title: inconsistant results
customer_reviews.text: The collar settings are a bit hit or miss, one time a 12 is enough for the dog to react the next time its a 30, ive tried it on myself and holding it in the exact same place some times i can feel it on 8 then others im up to 40, this is very dangerous, My dog got a zap the other night on 30 and nothing, i tried several other times and nothing and then after 8-10 attempts he yelped out in pain, ill give it a week or
customer_reviews.author: Darren B.

customer_reviews.title: Best e-collar ever
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to “cheap out” on e-collars over the years.... I have learned to spend more on something that works! I’ve never been a fan of the idea of e-collars but the small incremental increases helps find a level of strength that gets the dogs attention, rather than hurt them. It has severely helped my dogs behavioral issues (alongside training). The charge lasts for days and quickly recharges.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool.
customer_reviews.text: Range is great and so is battery life. I don't really use it past level 8. It's got a corrective Boost button that can be programed to a set increment above whatever you're originally set to. I really like that. I use it to associate my voice and commands with a physical touch and it works wonders. It has a beep sound on it too!
customer_reviews.author: Mykii

customer_reviews.title: Worth it's weight in gold.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah....it is something I wish I did a while ago. It is one of those things that makes training that much easier and to date, I have only used the vibration as it more than easily gets his attention. At 100lb and young...he has spunk and in many instances at the wrong time. A short vibration shuts him down and refocuses his attention where it should be...on me.
customer_reviews.author: The Goat

customer_reviews.title: A Well Mannered Dog is Such A Joy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a game-changer. Have a real dog trainer show you how to use the e-collar. Our 10-month-old Wheaton Terrier learned so quickly with this tool. After only a handful of times that we actually used it, he has learned to walk with us off leash, not chase rabbits, and to stay when we tell him to. He wears the collar, but is always responsive to our verbal commands. Having him continue to wear it on our walks ensures that he is safe if a car approaches or if he's about to run onto an icy lake.
customer_reviews.author: Julee

customer_reviews.title: Used the shocker one day on a chocolate lab pup
customer_reviews.text: I have a young chocolate lab that is doing great learning basics. However, she love to run into our ravine. I used the vibrate first as I called her, and then gave the shock. The shock was only needed a few times when appropriately preceded with the vibration. After a short time of training, she comes immediately when the vibration mode is used. Don’t think I’ll need the shock button again. The quality of this device is far better than what my local pet store sold.
customer_reviews.author: Chowder

customer_reviews.title: Stops the Dog from Chasing the Cat!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescue puppy who has been terrorizing my cat and running off if she is off leash this quickly solves both of these issues with some patience and a few training sessions. It even stops her from incessantly barking in the yard and I only have to use the tap/vibration function to get her attention!
customer_reviews.author: S. Paine

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for that off-leash life
customer_reviews.text: We use the vibrate feature only, and it's been a total game changer for trips outside. We no longer need to fence in our yard, because our girl can now run free with the Educator e-collar. Strong reminder not to leave the collar on for long periods of time. The pressure of the prongs will create sores if you're not careful. These are pressure sores and NOT from the vibration. Found the battery life to be great for our mild use. Only needs charged every couple of days. Spends most of the day on but rarely press any buttons.
customer_reviews.author: SonJa

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: I messed with some cheap ones before this one. Instant pairing is amazing. As in as soon as the power is on its ready. Zero lag. I love devices that work like this! Had it now for a couple months or so and it is my German Sheppard daily walk collar. I use it as a command enforcement mainly go keep her from chasing down wildlife. Rarely now do I use the electric stimulant since she knows it comes after the tone. Will buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: karl f lundin

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and is very well designed and made
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed and made, many features, easy to use, high quality product, American-made. You’d think it’s German. Works flawlessly. I use it to control unwanted barking, and to occassionally correct the dog when off-leash. This is a great tool to use in conjunction with obedience training, and for specific behavior only, not as the only method to control dog behavior in general. There is no substitute for obedience training and daily practice. This great device will not make your dog obedient.
customer_reviews.author: MAGA

customer_reviews.title: Watch YouTube videos
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7-month-old German Shepherd that got kicked out of K-9 training.i picked my baby up and I bought everything they were using at the facility ( I bought a cheaper e-collar at first). The Educator is awesome, I was a little overwhelmed by the manual at first but I wasn’t discouraged. I watched YouTube videos and got my settings correct before I put it on my baby. This collar is awesome and I think it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Calbert

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This collar is exceptional in every way. The manufacturer hit a home run and thought of everything. I have tried several remote collars and none of them are even close with regards to quality and functions. This has been a great training tool for my dog. I love the lower correction levels, under 14 you can’t even feel but the dog can. I use it between 5 and 10. Having a higher range is great for those emergencies like her chasing a deer the other day. Used level 20 and she came right back to me. Look at some of the YouTube reviews from dog trainers. They have thought of everything with this product. Perfect fit for your hand.
customer_reviews.author: John V.

customer_reviews.title: We should have purchased this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: We have a young Belgian Malinois who is not super friendly to strangers. Our first trainer did not agree with the use of e-collars, but our second one does!!! When used properly these are a great training tool! We are still working with her in building her confidence in general which is helping with her behavior towards people she is not used to being around. This is the model our trainer recommended that we buy and it has worked wonderfully! My husband uses the light feature when he takes her for early morning walks as it is quite dark out this time of year. I just wish we would have purchased thus sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it but no luck yet
customer_reviews.text: I am still struggling with this. My dog is 12.5 lbs and the receiver seems so big! Adjusting the collar & the strength is hard. I ordered a new collar but it’s big too. I really need a trainer to help me. I am keeping it and hoping to find someone to help me in person. Watching videos helps but there are not enough with little dogs.
customer_reviews.author: linda c

customer_reviews.title: Great ecollar
customer_reviews.text: This collar was recommended by my dog trainer. My dog (a german shephard and soft coated wheaten) stayed at a board and train facility for where they initially introduced the collar to my dog. I highly recommend. It has a vibrate and electric setting. Easy to put on, easy to charge, easy to use. My dog knows she is "working" when her collar is on. I usually don't have to even use it. Just having it on is enough for her to be on her best behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Chloebeans

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: It was a little challenging to figure out how to use and even to cut on and off, but I figured it out and I had a friend help me to learn how to train my dog with. She has one and swears by it. It has made a big difference in my dog’s obedience . We had already had a trainer for him when we first got him so this was just an extra incentive for when he gets ultra excited/fearful when new people come by. My dog is ultrasensitive even though he’s a 50 pound Bernadoodle puppy, so I don’t need to turn it up any higher than number eight to get him to listen.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great results, collar battery not good after 1 year daily use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mini Einstein for my golden/lab mix. He is a large dog and had a probleM with jumping, especially on our older neighbor. We have been extremely happy with the purchase for training purposes. I love the flashlight and vibrate features! He learned very quickly and his recall is impeccable. My one issue- after one year of daily use, the collar no longer holds a charge for more than 2 hours (when we bought it, we probably charged it weekly and it seemed to never die). Now, the charging light never turns green and it only blinks orange/red when in use. I'll have to look into buying another collar or battery but otherwise this is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: I have a wonderful golden doodle. He is 18 months old. It was my fault for not making him stay down as a pup, but he likes to jump up on his favorite people. I like the ability to give him a vibration instead of a shock. I would never shock my best buddy, especially when it was my fault for not teaching him to stay down when he was younger. He is very smart, so only after a few times he realized it was something he was not supposed to be doing. The product itself is very durable and I like how they have a dual charger. Very very humane! I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Gene Davis

customer_reviews.title: Godsend!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a godsend. I got my St Bernard from a family who could no longer keep him. He was not quite 1 when I got him. He was an unruly 145lbs child. This has worked wonders. I’m no stranger to large breed. We had a 175lbs English Mastiff but I went through training with her from a puppy. It didn’t take Moose long to get it when I used this collar. Like I said it was a godsend. Now I don’t even have to use it, I give the command and he obeys.
customer_reviews.author: Mortisha

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money for me...
customer_reviews.text: This was a very expensive unit and the only thing I have managed to get it to do is vibrate both dogs with the red button. Which makes it totally unfair for the dog who's doing nothing wrong. Would have sent it back but missed by 3 days. If it didn't take forever to try and get it set up, I wouldn't have been out almost 300 dollars. Going with a easy cheaper set up now.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this highly for training
customer_reviews.text: My labradoodle has been on the course with me since he was 8 months. This helped me train him quick and safe. He won't go into bunkers, won't go after golf balls and comes to me on demand when I use the vibration function. I recommend this highly for training. Great device and it's very safe. The light option is awesome too for those dark summer morning on the course.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this based on info available describing the product and reviews. Terrible. Battery life is terrible. Doesn’t last as long as my $40 collar and remote. Worse still is the design - having to unlock the intensity, set to 0 and then change from vibrate to tone is the dumbest design ever. The user should be able to easily move from tone, vibrate and shock. I tried it about 4 times but now it’s a $180 paperweight. Per Amazon, it’s too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S.

customer_reviews.title: Collars work phenomenally and exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: These collars work exactly as described. The range on these is incredible as well as have great flexibility on settings. It’s great to be able to control multiple dogs from a single remote and the layout of the remote makes it very easy to choose which dog without confusion. Love these collars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Z

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money! You won’t regret it-don’t settle for the cheap ones..this is it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST e-collar. It’s perfect for gentle stimulation, and dogs who need to learn how to focus- but who are sensitive to physical pressure. Just as an example, My dog feels it on a 5 (out of 100 ofcourse) and my 11 year old and I can’t feel it until 12. It’s the perfect tool to have for off leash work- thank you E-collar technologies!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Started working with my 3 year old 95 lb German Shepard and saw amazing results. This was purchased so I could train him to walk off leash. We have been walking off leash successfully for weeks now. Take your time and watch videos how to properly use and train with. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike V

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I recently had my dog professionally trained and the trainer recommended this collar. My dog has been a whole new dog with his collar and I find it very easy to use and I'm hoping after 4 to 6 months that we won't need a training collar at all. Worth it's weight gold.
customer_reviews.author: Single Tech Geek Mom

customer_reviews.title: Best eCollar on the market in range and programming
customer_reviews.text: This is the best eCollar on the market and worth the price. The 0-100 range let’s you dial in the minimum stimulation necessary to get the response you are looking for from the dog. Also, this version, which is the basic model, is much easier to use than my pro version and just as effective. Probably more effective because the commands are easier. I am very happy with the collar. One last bit of advice - the only collar is only as good as your training.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: My Roxy responds beautifully to just the beep,but I find it hard to follow the instructions so I would not want to add any shock. I don't use it for long periods,so am not certain about battery life. Have not used vibration only beep. The quality seems excellent and it arrived quickly and we'll packaged. I bought this brand due to recommendations from dog training YouTube direction Solid K9 Training. They completely assure that this is best one.
customer_reviews.author: reeseinsc

customer_reviews.title: Needs better prongs/contacts
customer_reviews.text: I would give this product a 5 but the prongs that it comes with are not great. I have to tighten the collar a little too tight for my liking in order to be effective. I have 2 lab/mastiff mix pups where their hides aren’t all that thick but still has a hard time making contact with their skin. I Guess I’m going to have to shell out more money for better prongs/contacts. I really don’t want to shave them for this product to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: L.P.

customer_reviews.title: Like a new & perfect dog
customer_reviews.text: This product, along with training from a professional, has resulted in the most well behaved dog I've ever owned. I was having so much trouble training my rescue not to drag me down the street. He isn't food motivated and is anxious when outside. A command and, if needed, tap a button and he's right there by my side. I say if needed for the button since 90% of the time he responds to verbal command. He will recall correctly EVERY time now so i'm able to let him run in the fields near my house off leash with the confidence he will come when called.
customer_reviews.author: S. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: and the beep works best for him
customer_reviews.text: So far it's been working flawlessly. I've only charged it once and have been using it for about two weeks, this is because I only need to use the beep. The main thing I use this for us to break my dog's concentration on prey, and the beep works best for him. I've used the shock twice following the beep, and haven't had to since. Your mileage may vary, my dog is a doberman mix that is a pretty good listener to begin with. I haven't tested the distance of the signal but it's worked as far as I will let my dog go in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent training collar for my two dogs
customer_reviews.text: I love this collar for training both of my dogs. I do wish the strength of correction could be adjusted so both dogs could have different strengths and I wish the correction boost were just a longer push of the button for the collar you wanted to make the correction. Other than that, I like the variety of strengths the collars use since I have two dogs that need very different correcting.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Essential tool for modern training
customer_reviews.text: This is everything you need from e collar for the average dog owner. It has vibration mode and stim level from 0-100, so you can be extremely precise and conservative with how much stim you use or just use vibration if you prefer. The battery is excellent, programming wasn’t too hard, I bought an additional collar and use one remote for both my dogs, I’ve used this collar for years now without issue. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Seroyer

customer_reviews.title: Junk, broke 2x in 6mo
customer_reviews.text: First the antenna came apart and fell off after 2 months. At the 6 month mark the effective distance, line of sight, is less than 200 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works!e
customer_reviews.text: Great product,but best if you have a professional trainer to show you the ropes. Not sure I would have done well without one. There are good videos if you don't have access to a trainer. Now all I have to do is show the dog the remote without activating the collar and he comes running! One of the lowest settings is all I need to use.
customer_reviews.author: alma

customer_reviews.title: Poor dog. Crap metal on transistor.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs skin got infected where the transistor sits on his neck. After only a few days. I USED TO HAVE A SPORTDOG 425 it worked fine and he never fussed. I knew something was wrong when the Educator Upland Collar was off him and he started licking then bit it....I checked his neck. Infected. Goodbye educator.
customer_reviews.author: FuzzBumpus

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after having some reactivity issues with my GSD and it came highly recommended, but I haven’t even had the collar a year and it abruptly stopped working :( it will say it’s fully charged but the remote will not turn on. It was so expensive, and I can’t afford to get a new one especially if that one does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: QueenBean94

customer_reviews.title: Stimulation selection button broke off under normal use.
customer_reviews.text: I'll update this review depending on how Educator Collars responds to my warranty request. I purchased this collar on August 15th 2018 and on September 10th 2019 the stimulation selection button broke off. There is only a small metal rod that connects the button to the unit. Now that it is broken, I can't change the level of stimulation. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect heavy training duty collars for our two lunkhead dogs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect heavy training duty collars for our two lunkhead dogs. They are a bit pricey but the wide array of adjustments and being able to remotely turn on the blinking or solid LED lights is a huge plus to find them in the dark, even though they come running with the stimulation anyhow. Check out theggoddogway.com for info on using these to train your dogs. I'm only a customer and not a rep. They have a LOT of valuable lessons on training your dogs with these collars.
customer_reviews.author: ToneBeast

customer_reviews.title: Please check your unit
customer_reviews.text: So please ch ed co your unit. I received mine and noticed box was bent and opened. Looked in and it had been used and I'm sure a return. Had dog hair on collar and no ties holding wires along with hair inside box. Paid full price for a used unit. Pretty shady. On a side note it turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Steinour

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the feature it describes as tapping. Turns out it is just vibrating. The collar is terrible. Instead of a flexible nylon collar thst quickly snaps together, it's a stiff, rubber like collar with a metal buckle. Also, very difficult to understand configuration and I'm a techie.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: The Best Electronic Collar
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Educator collar. I still use the first one, works great and I have had it for about 3 years. This one is for my second dog. These collars keep my headstrong dogs from getting kicked by my horses and keep them from chasing coyotes. Without these collars, these dogs would not be alive.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: We have big dogs and we like our collars.
customer_reviews.text: Nice collars for our Rhodesian Ridgebacks. We have a male and a female and they respond well to this system. My only gripe is that you need a Phd to understand all of the different functions with the remote. Directions are pretty technical. A bit pricey, but you get what you pay for. With Rhodesians, it is worth the investment. Battery life is very good. Excellent range.
customer_reviews.author: Sadness

customer_reviews.title: Our smart, stubborn dog went to training with a most ...
customer_reviews.text: Our smart, stubborn dog went to training with a most excellent trainer who used this e collar. She has trained us to use the collar with our dog and I am very happy with the results. The collar gives a vibration not a shock. Our dog knows when the collar goes on he's in training mode. It feels great to be able to recall him back when he's off leash. Keeps him safe and keeps me sane.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Michalowski

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: After going through a couple of cheaper dog training collars, both of which failed within 2 months, I bit the financial bullet and bought this one. I couldn't be happier. It is now months later and this heavy-duty unit is still doing all it said it could do. Very pleased. Highly recommended, by absolute autocratic authority of me, while sober.
customer_reviews.author: Audible Listener

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great!! I never liked having these type of products in my hand because somehow it just hurts me to shock my dog, but I have to say this is a great product I honestly started with a small number but since I have a husky with a lot of fur I wasn’t getting a reaction. To understand a little bit more I went on YouTube I needed to know what I was dealing with. I had to get it because my husky is a true stubborn so I needed to have a little more control over him and it was work wonderful. I truly recommend it. I tried it on myself to get a feeling of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Santiago

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE MUST!
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd is a good dog and well behaved at home and in the yard, but whenever there are strangers or cars, she absolutely loses it! Within one day of using this, she has learned to redirect her attention to me during these situations. She doesnt pull when walking on leash now and can without hesitation will immediately stop chasing year from our yard when I yell her name (as long as collar is on at this time). I dont use the pulse setting anymore. Her attention is grabbed with just the vibration setting now.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Melody

customer_reviews.title: High quality material
customer_reviews.text: You can tell really quick that this isn’t just another dog shock collar. Plenty of options to chose from. Very well made. High quality. Easy to use. Remote is on the larger size for normal around the house use, but I imagine that’s necessary for it’s intended long range use. Hopefully it will last.
customer_reviews.author: J. White

customer_reviews.title: Great tools for training!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my dogs and they work great! My dogs only need the vibration to deter them from what they were doing that wasn’t acceptable and they work great. Everyone in the house has felt the vibration and the stimulation so we know exactly what the dogs feel. They are great at helping us train the dogs to be off leash.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Jones

product_meta.title: Educator E-Collar Remote Dog Training Collar
product_meta.description:
Size:1/2 Mile 1 Dog| Color:Yellow

The Educator 1 Dog Mini Remote Training Collar ET-300 is a 1/2 mile range trainer that is especially made for smaller hands or for situations where discreetness is important. Utilizing "Lock and Set" technology, lithium polymer rechargeable batteries, waterproof floating remote, and waterproof receiver, the remote provides a very clean stimulation without the normal head jerking motion often found in other training collars. Includes one waterproof miniature collar receiver, one waterproof miniature floating remote, one Biothane collar, two sets of contact points (5/8" and 3/4"), contact point removal tool, dual battery charger (120V/220V) with a 2-hour full charge, owner's manual with training tips, lanyard for the remote and color storage box. NOTE: Kindly refer the user manual before usage of the product.Remote Activated LED Collar Light



 * Collar Receiver: 2.0”X1.5X1.1”, 2.4 oz.
 * Biothane Collar Strap: ¾” X 30”, 1.46 oz. (Ready to Cut to Size)
 * Floating Remote: 2.64” Diameter, 1.29” Thick and 3.4 oz.
 * Complete System in Box: 11”X6.9”X2.2”, 1.2 lbs.
feature_bullets: One dog system with 1/2 mile range
Small receiver (2"x1.5"x1", 2.4 oz) for dogs 5 pounds and larger
Mini ergonomic "stopwatch" transmitter (2.64" diameter x 1.29" thick) is well-suited for small hands or in situations where discreetness is important
Delivers a tapping sensation similar to vibration, but more intense, making it an effective addition to the stimulation
User-selectable stimulation levels from 1 to 100 with additional boost stimulus selectable from 1 to 60
Includes two sets of contact points (5/8" and 3/4").Biothane collar strap: ¾ X 30 inch, 1.46 ounce (Ready to cut to size)
Lithium-polymer rechargeable batteries with dual charger; 2-hour full charge,

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
